summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed after his death. It directs the distribution of his estate to The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One and appoints executors and successor executors to administer the estate.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One
events.description: The trust agreement for The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One was established.

locations: Little St. James Island, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will directs his entire estate to be transferred to The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One, established in 2001.
Epstein appointed Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman as the primary executors of his will.
Jes Staley and Andrew Farkas are named as successor executors if any primary executor is unable or unwilling to serve.
The will revokes all prior wills and codicils made by Epstein.
Epstein's domicile at the time of the will's creation was Little St. James Island in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
